![](data:image/png;base64, "NPM Logo") 

## node-package-tools ver. 1.0.1

![](https://badgen.net/npm/v/node-package-tools "NPM Version") ![](https://badgen.net/npm/license/node-package-tools "NPM License") ![](https://badgen.net/npm/types/node-package-tools "NPM Types") 

Automatic README.md generation for your package  
You can optionally add a package2md.json file in the root folder of your project.

### Home page

<https://github.com/caoshouse/node-package-tools#readme> 

### Repository

<https://github.com/caoshouse/node-package-tools> 

### Installation

```
npm install --save-dev node-package-tools
```

### Bugs

<https://github.com/caoshouse/node-package-tools/issues> 

### Examples

```
console.log('node-package-tools')
```

```
import fs from 'fs'
export function createReadme(packagePath: string, template: string = defaultTemplate) {
    const pkg = ModifiedPackage.getPackage(packagePath)
    console.log(Object.keys(ModifiedPackage._modules))
    fs.writeFileSync(path.join(packagePath, 'README.md'), hogan.compile(template).render(pkg))
}

```

### Dependencies

* [handlebars: 4.7.7][1] Handlebars provides the power necessary to let you build semantic templates effectively with no frustration (by Yehuda Katz )
* [hosted-git-info: 6.0.0][2] Provides metadata and conversions from repository urls for GitHub, Bitbucket and GitLab (by GitHub Inc. )
* [jsdom: 20.0.1][3] A JavaScript implementation of many web standards
* [mime-types: 2.1.35][4] The ultimate javascript content-type utility.
* [node-html-markdown: 1.2.0][5] Fast HTML to markdown cross-compiler, compatible with both node and the browser (by[ Ron S.][6] )

### devDependencies

* [@types/jsdom: 20.0.0][7] TypeScript definitions for jsdom
* [@types/node: 18.8.5][7] TypeScript definitions for Node.js
* [@types/hosted-git-info: 3.0.2][7] TypeScript definitions for hosted-git-info
* [@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin: 5.40.0][8] TypeScript plugin for ESLint
* [typescript: 4.8.4][9] TypeScript is a language for application scale JavaScript development (by Microsoft Corp. )

### Contributors

* [caoshouse][10]
